title: Office Administrator Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Green River College
Interview Descriptions: The interview was super easy. You usually go through 2 short interviews. They asked about very basic questions, like where you live, how you commute, and what your availability is. One question they asked was what you think good hospitality is. You know right after if you are hired or not.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Associate Director Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Green River College
Interview Descriptions: Good experience, you could tell they were serious about finding the best person for the job. Definitely would love to interview with them again if a similar position becomes available.
Interview Questions: Q: What unique experiences will benefit your work in this position?

title: Peer Mentor Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Green River College
Interview Descriptions: Not very hard. Just behavioral questions asked to test your communication skills. Other than that, it is just a normal conversation.  Easy interview and don't be nervous, and you should be fine.
Interview Questions: What would you do when you see an elderly crossing the street alone?

title: Receptionist Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Green River College (Auburn, WA) in Mar 2020
Interview Descriptions: I enjoyed the interview process, the interview panel was friendly. They wanted to learn about you and why you would be a good fit for the college. The college is quite culturally diverse. The interviewers were clear about the hiring process and provided helpful feedback.
Interview Questions: They asked a few situational questions.

title: Program Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Green River College in Jul 2017
Interview Descriptions:
There were two interviews; the first interview had a panel with about 4 members and the second interview was with the Director and President of the division. During the first interview, I received a phone call about a month after applying and was asked to come in for an interview. At that interview, it was held in a small conference room and I sat across from the panel. They handed me a paper with a list of questions and said I could review the questions before getting started and then they just went down the line of questions; each alternating in asking me the questions. 

The second interview was pretty laid back and was just a casual interview with the Director and President of the department and they asked me where I see myself in 5 years, why I wanted to work for that department, etc.
Interview Questions: How do you maintain your enthusiasm from student one to student 100.

title: Adjunct Librarian At Holman Library Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 6 weeks. I interviewed at Green River College (Auburn, WA) in Aug 2016
Interview Descriptions:
I taught a short mock information literacy session, and answered lots of standard questions about my experience working with students and faculty, as well as how I work with diverse populations. They were one of the few places I've interviewed with who gave me a copy of the questions, which is such a nice thing to do. It was actually a pretty good experience, as far as interviews go. All of the interviewers seemed very pleasant, and I thought I presented myself reasonably well. I left the interview feeling very positive.

However, after all of that rushed preparation and stress (the turnaround between being offered an interview and doing it was less than a week), as well as a lot of travel to get there, I was never contacted about their decision, even after checking in a month later by email. It was random chance that I happen to be friends with one of the two individuals who did get the position, so I know how things turned out. To me, that lack of even a brief form email letting me know I wasn't hired seems exceptionally rude and disrespectful of my time. I hope that whatever happened there was an error of some kind and not their usual policy.
Interview Questions: What part of this position are you most nervous about, and how would you handle that?

title: IT Quality Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. I interviewed at Green River College (Auburn, WA) in Sept 2015
Interview Descriptions: I attended a scheduled meeting with the person who would be my supervisor during employment. My employee referral acted as a liason and this greatly increased the casual feeling of the introductions. We knew ahead of time that this would be a limited duration employment. The interview was held in a private area, and problems were asked and discussed on paper, though a whiteboard was available should I have chosen to use it.
Interview Questions: Types of joins in SQL, Programming languages known, how to write an algorithm in a given language

title: Math Tutor Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. I interviewed at Green River College (Auburn, WA) in Jan 2014
Interview Descriptions: Applied in person. I talked to the supervisor who was a Math instructor at Green River. She scheduled an interview within a week. Interview was easy, mostly tested your knowledge on math, and explaining skills
Interview Questions: Can you explain to me how to solve this problem?

title: Math Tutor Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Green River College (Auburn, WA)
Interview Descriptions: She asked some basic math problems to solve. It's not that hard.
Interview Questions: Some questions take little time to think.

title: IT Instructor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Green River College (Auburn, WA) in Aug 2013
Interview Descriptions: Interview questions range from trivial to complex scenario based and finally to high level technical questions. You have to be prepared to answer questions of different working scenarios and the decisions you decided to take.
Interview Questions: Explain a scenario where you were given an assignment with a team mate and your team mate failed to deliver. What did you do?

title: Administrative Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Green River College (Auburn, WA) in Sept 2009
Interview Descriptions: I applied for the job online. Was called in for a first interview. A week later they called me in for a second interview. And then they called a day later to let me know they want me to start ASAP.
Interview Questions: How do you handle yourself under pressure?

They asked about very basic questions, like where you live, how you commute, and what your availability is. One question they asked was what you think good hospitality is. You know right after if you are hired or not.
Interview Questions: N/A
